:'''a.'''{{Note label|A|a|none}} Studies on divorce in the [[United States]] done by the Barna Group suggested that [[atheists]] and [[agnostics]] have lower divorce rates than faith groups on average (though some faith groups had [[Religion and divorce|lower rates]] still).<ref name="barna1"/><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.adherents.com/largecom/baptist_divorce.html |title= Survey Inspires Debate Over Why Faith Isn't a Bigger Factor in Marriage |first= Christine |last= Wicker|year= 2000|publisher= www.adherents.com|accessdate= 1 April 2012}}</ref> The study notes that fewer atheists and agnostics enter into marriage relative to faith-based individuals.
 
:'''a.'''{{Note label|A|a|none}} Studies on divorce in the [[United States]] done by the Barna Group suggested that [[atheists]] and [[agnostics]] have lower divorce rates than faith groups on average (though some faith groups had [[Religion and divorce|lower rates]] still).<ref name="barna1"/><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.adherents.com/largecom/baptist_divorce.html |title= Survey Inspires Debate Over Why Faith Isn't a Bigger Factor in Marriage |first= Christine |last= Wicker|year= 2000|publisher= www.adherents.com|accessdate= 1 April 2012}}</ref> The study notes that fewer atheists and agnostics enter into marriage relative to faith-based individuals.
